tweet: MoneroV Update: We're not planning to support the MoneroV [XMV] non-native fork of Monero [XMR] planned for April 30, 2018. Their team recently contacted us, but they did not apply in time to complete our token review process before the fork date.  https://t.co/TsVFTQTpz5

Uhhh, no @Poloniex, that’s not even vaguely correct. A scam announced they’re airdropping via a blockchain fork, it has nothing to do with the Monero network. If any old scammer can disrupt you by announcing a fork then someone’s just going to announce a new one every day.  https://t.co/lKP9qp9aLT

We've received some questions on the upcoming Monero hard fork at block 1564965. We plan to pause XMR deposits and withdrawals starting at 5pm EDT on April 29, and re-enable once the network stabilizes. We do not plan to support XMV at this time.

I'm sure you have heard about #Monero by now. Wanted to introduce @eXMRCoin, a tokenized version of Monero. Take a look at  https://t.co/u10q512iOy if you have not yet. They are working towards blending crypto and it functioning efficiently as a payment gateway. #sp #crypto

You can choose to move your XMR to an exchange or wallet that supports Monero forks. Stay tuned for more information on how we plan to approach listings, forks, swaps, and airdrops on Poloniex going forward.
